meanings.definition: The action of fixing the limits or boundaries of something.
meanings.sent1: The delimitation of the playground area was necessary to ensure safety for the children.
meanings.sent2: The delimitation of the property lines helped prevent any disputes between neighbors.
meanings.sent3: The delimitation of the cake slices at the party led to some comical confusion among the guests.
meanings.sent4: Her delimitation of personal space was like an invisible force field that no one dared to cross.
meanings.sent5: The delimitation of the treasure map made it easier for the pirates to follow the clues.

meanings.definition: The process of determining the extent or scope of something.
meanings.sent1: Through careful delimitation, the researchers were able to define the parameters of their study.
meanings.sent2: The delimitation of responsibilities within the team helped improve efficiency.
meanings.sent3: The delimitation of the picnic area turned into a fun game of 'find the perfect spot'.
meanings.sent4: Her delimitation of time for each task was like a well-oiled machine, keeping everything on track.
meanings.sent5: The delimitation of the problem allowed for a clear path towards finding a solution.
